identificationModule.briefTitle: Effectiveness of FACoT for Individuals Post Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effectiveness of a Novel Meta-cognitive-functional Intervention (FACoT) for Individuals Post Mild-moderate Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To develop and assess the effectiveness of a novel cognitive-functional intervention (FACoT) in occupational therapy for people after mild to moderate stroke.

armGroups.label: FACoT group
armGroups.description: treatment group will receive FACoT, that include one to one 10 treatment sessions. the treatment sessions will include: functional activities, cognitive activities and strategies (pencil-pen treatment), and behavioural strategies

armGroups.label: control group
armGroups.description: control group receiving standard care - cognitive and functional assesment

interventions.name: FaCoT
interventions.description: The intervention will include: functional activities, cognitive activities and strategies (pencil-pen treatment), and behavioural strategies

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of The Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention -10-13 weeks later) and time 2 (follow-up- three month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of the Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of Reintegration to Normal Living Index (RNL)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up-3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of Short Form-12v2 Health Survey (SF-12v2)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: change in scoe of New general self efficacy scale (NGSE)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of Patient competency rating scale (PCRS)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores Self Regulation Skills Interview (SRSI)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up-3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of Trail making test (TMT)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)
Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up-3 month later)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in scores of Dysexecutive Questionnaire (DEX)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3month later)
Change between baseline (week 0) to time 1 (post-intervention, 10-13 weeks later) and between baseline to time 2 (follow-up- 3 month later)

otherOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
inclusion criteria:

* \>18 years
* at least three years post stroke
* severity mild to moderate (NIHSSâ‰¤5)
* independent prior to the stroke
* can understand and speak Hebrew

Exclusion Criteria:

* with no other neurological or psychiatric conditions
* without dementia
